laboratory_examinations.findings: Prolonged QTc interval of 600 ms and polymorphic ventricular tachyarrhythmias documented soon after birth.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The initial ECG showed sinus rhythm and normal QTc interval (410 ms); a subsequent ECG on day 5 showed marked QTc prolongation of 600 ms.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Documented T-wave alternans and increased QT dispersion.
Sodium, potassium, magnesium, and calcium levels were in the normal range.
Identified a G-to-C transversion leading to a heterozygous mutation (Ala1330Pro) in exon 23 of the SCN5A gene, absent in parents.
